fif_core

Class ResourceRegister

  • java.lang.Object
    • fif_core.ResourceRegister

  • public class ResourceRegister
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a register containing associations between a resource and its descriptor.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Troiano Lorenzo

    • Method Detail

      • associateDescriptor

        public void associateDescriptor(Resource r,
                                Descriptor d)
        Associates a resource to a descriptor.

        You can associate the same descriptor even to two or more resource.
        If you associate a descriptor to a resource already existing in the registry, the old descriptor will be overwrite from the new descriptor.
        If you don't want to overwrite an association when the resource already exists, use the method checkAssociation to check for resource presence in the registry.

        Preconditions:

        1-The resource is not equal to null.
        2-The descriptor is not equal to null.
        Postconditions:

        1-The descriptor is associated correctly.

        Parameters:
        r - The resource for which you want to associate a descriptor.
        d - The descriptor you want to associate.

      • checkAssociation

        public boolean checkAssociation(Resource r)
        Checks if exists a descriptor associated to a resource.

        Preconditions:

        1-The resource is not equal to null.
        Postconditions:

        1-It's returned true if exists associated descriptor or false otherwise.

        Parameters:
        r - The resource of which you want to check if exists an association.
        Returns:
        It's returned true if exists associated descriptor or false otherwise.

      • getDescriptor

        public Descriptor getDescriptor(Resource r)
        Returns the descriptor associated to a resource.

        Remember: the only condition for which it's returned null is only if resource doesn't exist. This because in the association you can't associate a null descriptor, so any associations will be with two not null values. Preconditions:

        1-The resource is not equal to null.
        Postconditions:

        1-It's returned the associated descriptor if resource exists or null otherwise.

        Parameters:
        r - The resource of which you want to get the associated descriptor.
        Returns:
        The associated descriptor if resource exists or null otherwise.

      • getinstance

        public static ResourceRegister getinstance()
        This method implements the singleton pattern and returns the only possible instance of this class.
        Returns:
        the instance of this class

      • getSequence

        public java.util.ArrayList<Resource> getSequence()

      • removeAllAssocitions

        public void removeAllAssocitions()

      • removeAssociation

        public void removeAssociation(Resource r)
        Removes a resource and its associated descriptor from the register.

        Preconditions:

        1-The resource is not equal to null.
        Postconditions:

        1-It's removed the resource and the associated descriptor.

        Parameters:
        r - The resource-descriptor association you want to remove.
